results.title: Buying blues
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Law”.
A young girl takes a clothing retailer to the Consumer Claims Tribunal claiming that her newly purchased jeans were falsely represented. The complainant, the trader and their witnesses give different versions of what happened at the point of sale. The referee has to decide where the truth lies. Based on a true story. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Accident
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Law”.
A serious accident brings a tragic end to the dreams and ambitions of a young migrant worker. Looks at the rights of workers and the responsibility of management in industrial accidents. Opens up for consideration the alternatives of Workers Compensation or suing under judge made law.

results.title: Working agreement
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Law”.
Shows how an industrial award comes into being, tracing the progress of a new log of claims by workers as it moves from negotiations between unions and employers thorugh to the Conciliation and Arbitration Commission. Cast includes Henri Szeps, Gordon Piper, Maggie Kirkpatrick. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Lesley
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Law”.
A drama based on a real life story, about a runaway girl and an uncaring mother. The film explores the duties of parents to protect their children from danger. Examines the rights of magistrates and judges to control a child’s environment for what is seen to be the child’s benefit. Director of Photography: John Seale

results.title: Jelly-like, worm-like and colonial invertebrates
results.creator_credit: Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Intertidal Life of the North American Pacific Coast”.
This film covers various invertebrates living on the shores of British Columbia. Included are jellyfish, anemones, worms and the colonial bryozoans.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Molluscs
results.creator_credit: Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Intertidal Life of the North American Pacific Coast”.
The marine fauna of the British Columbian coast is extremely diverse. The more common animals of the phylum molluscs from the classes Amphineura, Gastropoda, Pelecypoda, Cephalopoda are illustrated. Shows their size, habitat and feeding habits. Industrialisation and pollution have led to the destruction of many molluscs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Echinoderms
results.creator_credit: Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Intertidal Life of the North American Pacific Coast”.
A few species of the phylum Echinodermata found in the rich environment of the North American Pacific coast are shows. Four of the five classes are found in the inter-tidal region: Asteroidea, sea-stars; Ophiuroidea, brittle stars; Holothuriodea, sea cucumbers; and Echinoidea, sea-urchins. Uses micro-photogpraphy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Service Burnout
results.creator_credit: Peter Quarry, Eve Ash and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Improving Service”.
Service burnout is a stress reaction suffered by frontline and service staff. Addresses physical and emotional symptoms, effects on customer service, prevention of burnout and how to remedy existing cases of burnout.
